translated: That cannot be maintained.🔽Does ear-consciousness arise contingent upon eye-consciousness, but is it not the case that

original: “yā cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhi, sāva sotaviññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhī”ti?
analyzed: yā cakkhu viññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi sā ava sota viññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: the inclining, the tendency, the orientation, the heading, the disposition, the inclination, the bent, the urge, the drive, the volition, the resolution, the application, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the mental initiative, the endeavour of eye-consciousness is the inclining, the tendency, the orientation, the heading, the disposition, the inclination, the bent, the urge, the drive, the volition, the resolution, the application, the effort, the striving, the exertion, the mental initiative, the endeavour of ear-consciousness?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

analyzed: sota viññāṇam an āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati pe appaṇidahantassa uppajjati iti
translated: Does ear-consciousness arise in one who does not incline, tend, orient, head, dispose, incline, bend, urge, drive, will, resolve, apply, endeavour, strive, exert, initiate, or make an effort with eye-consciousness?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: That cannot be maintained.

original: Nanu sotaviññāṇaṁ āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati …pe… paṇidahantassa uppajjatīti?
analyzed: nanu sota viññāṇam āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati pe paṇidahantassa uppajjati iti
translated: But is it not the case that ear-consciousness arises in one who inclines, tends, orients, heads, disposes, inclines, bends, urges, drives, wills, resolves, applies, endeavours, strives, exerts, initiates, or makes an effort with eye-consciousness?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

original: Hañci sotaviññāṇaṁ āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati …pe… paṇidahantassa uppajjati, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“cakkhuviññāṇassa anantarā sotaviññāṇaṁ uppajjatī”ti.
analyzed: hañci sota viññāṇam āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati pe paṇidahantassa uppajjati no ca vata re vattabbe  cakkhu viññāṇassa anantarā sota viññāṇam uppajjati iti

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa anantarā sota viññāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: “But is it proper to say that ear-consciousness arises in dependence on eye-consciousness?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam rūpa nimittam manasikarotaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: “When someone is directing his mind to eye-consciousness, does eye-consciousness arise?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.

analyzed: sota viññāṇam rūpa nimittam manasikarotaḥ uppajjati iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “When someone is directing his mind to ear-consciousness, does ear-consciousness arise?🔽“No.

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam rūpa ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: “Is it proper to say that eye-consciousness has only form as its object, not some other object?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.

analyzed: sota viññāṇam rūpa ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

original: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇanti?
analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇam ti
translated: “Is it proper to say that eye-consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.

original: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇanti?
analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati sota viññāṇanti

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …

original: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇanti?
analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati sota viññāṇanti
translated: “Is it proper to say that ear-consciousness arises in dependence on the ear and sounds?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati sota viññāṇanti
translated: “Ear-consciousness arises in dependence on the ear and sounds.”

analyzed: atthā iva suttanto ti

analyzed: natthi
translated: There isn’t.

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇam ti
translated: “Eye-consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.”

analyzed: atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: Is there such a discourse?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: There is.

original: Hañci “cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇan”ti—
analyzed: hañci cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇanti
translated: “Ear-consciousness arises in dependence on the ear and sounds.”🔽Is there such a discourse?

original: attheva suttanto, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: attha iva suttantaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: You shouldn’t say so.

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati sota viññāṇanti
translated: “Ear-consciousness arises in dependence on the ear and sounds.”🔽Is there such a discourse?🔽You shouldn’t say so.

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa anantarā sota viññāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: Does ear-consciousness arise immediately after eye-consciousness?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: There is.

analyzed: tat na eva cakkhu viññāṇam tat sota viññāṇam ti
translated: Is that eye-consciousness the same as that ear-consciousness?

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Sotaviññāṇassa anantarā ghānaviññāṇaṁ uppajjati …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  sota viññāṇassa anantarā ghāna viññāṇam uppajjati pe

analyzed: ghāna viññāṇassa anantarā jivhā viññāṇam uppajjati pe

analyzed: jivhā viññāṇassa anantarā kāya viññāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: Does body-consciousness arise immediately after tongue-consciousness?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: There is.

original: Yā jivhāviññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhi, sāva kāyaviññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: yā jivhā viññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi sā ava kāya viññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: Is the inclining, the leading, the aiming of consciousness that arises with tongue-contact the inclining, the leading, the aiming of consciousness that arises with body-contact?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: You say: “No.”

original: jivhāviññāṇassa anantarā kāyaviññāṇaṁ uppajjati, na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: jivhā viññāṇassa anantarā kāya viññāṇam uppajjati na vattabba
translated: Is the consciousness that arises with body-contact next to the consciousness that arises with tongue-contact,

original: “yā jivhāviññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhi, sāva kāyaviññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhī”ti?
analyzed: yā jivhā viññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi sā ava kāya viññāṇassa uppādāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: and is it the case that the inclining, the leading, the aiming of the consciousness that arises with tongue-contact is the inclining, the leading, the aiming of the consciousness that arises with body-contact?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: You say: “No.”

analyzed: kāya viññāṇam an āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati pe appaṇidahantassa uppajjati iti
translated: Does the consciousness that arises with body-contact arise without inclining, without leading, without aiming?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: You say: “No.”

original: nanu kāyaviññāṇaṁ āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati …pe… paṇidahantassa uppajjatīti?
analyzed: nanu kāya viññāṇam āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati pe paṇidahantassa uppajjati iti
translated: Then is it not the case that the consciousness that arises with body-contact arises with inclining, with leading, with aiming?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: You say: “Yes.”

original: Hañci kāyaviññāṇaṁ āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati …pe… paṇidahantassa uppajjati, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci kāya viññāṇam āvaṭṭentassa uppajjati pe paṇidahantassa uppajjati no ca vata re vattabbe

analyzed: jivhā viññāṇassa anantarā kāya viññāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: “The consciousness that arises with body-contact arises next to the consciousness that arises with tongue-contact.”

analyzed: jivhā viññāṇassa anantarā kāya viññāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: Does the consciousness that arises with body-contact arise next to the consciousness that arises with tongue-contact?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: You say: “Yes.”

analyzed: jivhā viññāṇam rasa nimittam manasikarotaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: Does tongue-consciousness arise in one who gives attention to the sign of taste?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

analyzed: kāya viññāṇam rasa nimittam manasikarotaḥ uppajjati iti
translated: Does body-consciousness arise in one who gives attention to the sign of taste?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe

analyzed: jivhā viññāṇam rasa ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: Is it only the sign of taste that is the object of tongue-consciousness, not some other object?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

analyzed: kāya viññāṇam rasa ārammaṇañca eva na añña ārammaṇanti
translated: Is it only the sign of taste that is the object of body-consciousness, not some other object?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: You are not entitled to say so.

original: Jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇanti?
analyzed: jivham ca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhā viññāṇam ti
translated: Does tongue-consciousness arise in dependence on the tongue and on tastes?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

original: Jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇanti?
analyzed: jivham ca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāya viññāṇam ti
translated: Does body-consciousness arise in dependence on the tongue and on tastes?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: You are not entitled to say so.

original: Jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇanti?
analyzed: jivham ca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāya viññāṇam ti
translated: Does body-consciousness arise in dependence on the body and on tastes?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

analyzed: jivham ca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāya viññāṇam ti
translated: “Body-consciousness arises in dependence on the body and on tastes” —

analyzed: atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: is there such a discourse?

analyzed: natthi
translated: No, there isn’t.

analyzed: jivham ca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhā viññāṇam ti
translated: “Tongue-consciousness arises in dependence on the tongue and on tastes” —

analyzed: atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: is there such a discourse?

analyzed: āmantā
translated: Yes.

original: Hañci “jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇan”ti—
analyzed: hañci jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhā viññāṇanti
translated: “Tongue-consciousness arises in dependence on the tongue and on tastes” —

original: attheva suttantoti, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāyaviññāṇan”ti.
analyzed: attha iva suttantaḥ ti no ca vata re vattabbe  jivham ca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati kāya viññāṇam ti
translated: “There is a sutta that shows this,” “You should not say that.”🔽“Ear-consciousness arises in dependence on the ear and sounds.”

analyzed: jivhā viññāṇassa anantarā kāya viññāṇam uppajjati iti
translated: “Does body-consciousness arise immediately after ear-consciousness?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.”

original: Taññeva jivhāviññāṇaṁ taṁ kāyaviññāṇanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: tam kāya viññāṇam ti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is that same ear-consciousness also body-consciousness?”🔽“No.”

analyzed: na vattabba
translated: “You should not say that.”

analyzed: pañca viññāṇāḥ aññamaññassa samanantarāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: “Do the five kinds of consciousness arise immediately after one another?”

analyzed: āmantā
translated: “Yes.”

original: Nanu atthi koci naccati gāyati vādeti, rūpañca passati, saddañca suṇāti, gandhañca ghāyati, rasañca sāyati, phoṭṭhabbañca phusatīti?
analyzed: nanu atthi koci naccati gāyati vādeti rūpañca passati saddañca suṇāti gandhañca ghāyati rasañca sāyati phoṭṭhabbañca phusati iti
translated: “But don’t people dance, sing, play music, and see and hear forms and sounds, and smell, taste, and touch objects?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci atthi koci naccati gāyati vādeti, rūpañca passati, saddañca suṇāti, gandhañca ghāyati, rasañca sāyati, phoṭṭhabbañca phusati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci atthi koci naccati gāyati vādeti rūpañca passati saddañca suṇāti gandhañca ghāyati rasañca sāyati phoṭṭhabbañca phusati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: pañca viññāṇāḥ aññamaññassa samanantarāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: “Well then, you should say that the five kinds of consciousness arise immediately after one another.”

analyzed: anantara paccaya kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the condition being immediately followed is finished.
